details.description: This study model looked at the option of using a lattice to bring the concept of 'convergence in chess',  into architecture.
details.name: Lattice Study

details.description: As part of our Drawing Summer Foundation course, we had to take elements from Ed Lissitzky's "Proun" Series and abstract them to create a new image that could eventually be turned into a space.
details.name: Untitled (Proun Drawing)

details.description:
The RISD 2nd Life project was a group project completed by the 1st year MDes Students in the Interior Architecture department at the Rhode Island School of Design. As part of their first semester's Introduction to Design Studio, the students were given 6 weeks and a budget of 5,000 dollars to re-design the interior of the RISD 2nd Life Store: a not for profit, second-hand material store that sells donated material in Providence, at a discounted price. 

There were many challenges that needed to be overcome in order to complete the project, but the greatest challenge was solving the central design challenge: how do you create a modular storage device that can accommodate an infinite and unpredictable range of inventory, on a budget of less than 5,000 dollars? 

The students pulled together and worked diligently to create a solution that could accommodate a range of objects, through a modular deign that created new storage opportunities through rotation. 

Studio Professors: Yugon Kim, Justin Cook and Rui Goulart de Almeida

details.name: RISD 2nd Life: Final Installation

details.description:
This was a two-phase project assigned as part of our Interior Architecture Summer Foundation Program. The development phase of the assignment asked us to to apply the operation 'to bend' to the interior plan of a given space. Next that plan had to be drawn in a volumetric axon, altered to accommodate storage and display needs, and realized in a 1:1 detail model. 

Phase 2 asked us to combine our initial design concept with a partner to develop a proposal for the re-design of a local second hand material store.

Project Partner: Reem Al Thani
details.name: 2nd Life Collaboative Summer Proposal

details.description: Our first summer studio assignment asked us to alter the interior space of a shoebox, based on a series of prompts. The prompt for this project was to create a space ‘of tension’ that have the feeling of ‘oppressive’. By shrinking available space, limiting circulation and playing with scale,  I began to think of tension as friction between the individual and the limitations of their comfort in a space.
details.name: Of Tension (Part 2)
